DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether two different strategy Non Invasive Ventilation ( NIV ) different effect length failure NIV support preterm infant respiratory distress syndrome ( RDS ) .
DOC.brief_title: NIV Strategies RDS Preterm Infants . NIV ( Non Invasive Ventilation ) , RDS ( Respiratory Distress Syndrome )
DOC.detailed_description: A Randomized Control Trial ( RCT ) conduct two tertiary level Neonatal Intensive Care Unit ( NICU ) . Ethical approval need . Informed write consent obtain prior delivery parent baby inclusion study . All inborn Very Low Birth Weight ( VLBW ) infant ( Birthweight less 1500 g Gestational Age < 32 week ) sign RDS , spontaneously breathe support nasal-Continuous Positive Airway Pressure ( NCPAP ) NICU , randomize within first 2 hour life receive two different Non Invasive Ventilation ( NIV ) strategy : Nasal Synchronized Intermittent Positive Pressure Ventilation ( N-SIPPV ) Bilevel Continuous Positive Airway Pressure ( BiPAP ) .
DOC.criteria: All inborn VLBW infant ( birthweight less 1500 g Gestational Age < 32 wks ) sign RDS , spontaneously breathe support NCPAP , randomize within first 2 hour life receive two different Non Invasive Ventilation ( NIV ) strategy . Apneic severely depress newborn require invasive ventilation , within two hour birth Newborns genetic disease and/or major congenital malformation Newborns obtain informed consent within two hour birth
